byline.contributor: Patrick Reevell and Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Moscow.

abstract: UEFA fines Russian soccer federation about $170,000 and issues suspended disqualification from European Championships after its fans clash with England supporters inside stadium during match; officials take precautions to prevent another violation, which would have remarkable consequence of disqualifying nation that is set to host next World Cup.

headline.print_headline: As Fans Turn Violent at Euros, Russia Faces a Threat: Expulsion
headline.main: As Fans Turn Violent at Euros, Russia Faces a Threat: Expulsion

snippet: Russia was given a suspended disqualification from the European Championships as punishment for fan violence, putting the team on the verge of being kicked out of the competition.
lead_paragraph: Russia was given a suspended disqualification from the European Championships as punishment for fan violence, putting the team on the verge of being kicked out of the competition.
